case_vignette:
A 35-year-old man presents with yellow discoloration of his eyes and skin for the past week. He also says he has pain in the right upper quadrant for the past few days. He is fatigued constantly and has recently developed acute onset itching all over his body. The patient denies any allergies. Past medical history is significant for ulcerative colitis diagnosed 2 years ago, managed medically. He is vaccinated against hepatitis A and B and denies any recent travel abroad. There is scleral icterus present, and mild hepatosplenomegaly is noted. The remainder of the physical examination is unremarkable. Laboratory findings are significant for:
Total bilirubin 3.4 mg/dL
Prothrombin time 12 s
Aspartate transaminase (AST) 158 IU/L
Alanine transaminase (ALT) 1161 IU/L
Alkaline phosphatase 502 IU/L
Serum albumin 3.1 g/dL
Perinuclear antineutrophil cytoplasmic antibodies (p-ANCA) positive
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Gastrointestinal System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?

My eyes and skin have turned yellow for the past week, I've been feeling a pain in the upper right side of my belly for a few days, I'm always tired, and I've started to feel itchy all over my body very suddenly.
How old are you and what is your sex?
I am a 35-year-old man.
Have you had any recent changes in your urine or stool color?
The case vignette doesn't mention any changes in my urine or stool color.
Do you have a history of liver disease, alcohol use, or hepatitis?
I have no history of liver disease, I haven't mentioned alcohol use, and I'm vaccinated against hepatitis A and B. I haven't traveled abroad recently either.
Have you noticed any changes in your weight recently, such as unintentional weight loss?
The case vignette doesn't mention any changes in my weight.
Do you have a family history of liver disease or gallstones?
There's no information about my family history of liver disease or gallstones in the case vignette.
Are you currently taking any medications or supplements, including over-the-counter or herbal products?
The case vignette does not provide information about my current use of medications or supplements.
Have you had any recent injuries or infections that you're aware of?
I haven't mentioned any recent injuries or infections.
Do you have any other medical conditions or have you noticed any other symptoms not already mentioned?
I was diagnosed with ulcerative colitis 2 years ago, and I'm managing it medically, but I haven't mentioned any other conditions or symptoms.
Final Diagnosis: Obstructive jaundice, likely secondary to extrahepatic biliary obstruction, possibly related to complications of ulcerative colitis such as Primary Sclerosing Cholangitis (PSC).
